intro: Carex angustifructus, commonly known as narrow-fruited sedge, is a perennial plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grass-like leaves and spike-like flower clusters. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. It is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams.
